result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin James Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due. 

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol or any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain employment as treatment allows.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin James Smith

records.addlTxt: Same appearances.  Guilty plea entered. Court finds def guilty and enters judgment.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Austin James Smith appeared by video from treatment facility.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Austin James Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22CF208; 22CF251)  Defendant waives right to appear in person.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.

Letter from Atty. Drewa requesting zoom appearance
10-4-2022 EOZ-Court permits defendant to appear by zoom for 10-5-2022 and zoom info provided to counsel.

ADDRESS INFO for Austin James Smith
Current: 2116 Deerfield Rd, West Bend, WI 53095 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2022)
Prior: 141 S 8Th Av, West Bend, WI 53095

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Austin James Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran appeared by video for Austin James Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. (20CF208; 22CF251)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  State indicates the defendant is on a PO hold and does not oppose a signature bond.  Atty. Beltran does not oppose.  Court orders $1,500.00 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
